intro: Peripeplus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. These plants are typically found in coastal areas, where they thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Peripeplus species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to tolerate salt spray. They play a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and supporting local biodiversity.
